ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with identical phenotypes (sensorineural hearing impairment and delayed speech/language) were diagnosed with this condition. The patient presents with the core features seen in these cases.
GJB2-related hearing loss is the most common form of autosomal recessive non-syndromic hearing loss, presenting with congenital sensorineural hearing impairment and secondary speech delays.
OTOF-related deafness presents with prelingual profound sensorineural hearing loss leading to speech and language delays, similar to the patient's presentation.
While this syndrome includes sensorineural hearing loss and speech delays, it typically also features thyroid abnormalities and inner ear malformations not mentioned in this case.
Presents with congenital profound sensorineural hearing loss and speech delays, but typically includes progressive retinitis pigmentosa which is not reported here.
Can present with sensorineural hearing loss and speech delays, but usually includes pigmentary abnormalities of hair, skin, and eyes not mentioned in this case.
